translations.Please provide a valid app key and secre: Please provide a valid app key and secret.
translations.Invalid backend or authentication mechan: Invalid backend or authentication mechanism class
translations.Not permitted to use authentication mech: Not permitted to use authentication mechanism "%s"
translations.Storage with ID \"%d\" is not editable b: Storage with ID "%d" is not editable by non-admins
translations.Disabling it will allow to use a case in: Disabling it will allow to use a case insensitive file system, but comes with a performance penalty
translations.Verify ACL access when listing files: Verify ACL access when listing files
translations.Check the ACL's of each file or folder i: Check the ACL's of each file or folder inside a directory to filter out items where the account has no read permissions, comes with a performance penalty
translations.The cURL support in PHP is not enabled o: The cURL support in PHP is not enabled or installed. Mounting of %s is not possible. Please ask your system administrator to install it.
translations.The FTP support in PHP is not enabled or: The FTP support in PHP is not enabled or installed. Mounting of %s is not possible. Please ask your system administrator to install it.
translations.\"%1$s\" is not installed. Mounting of %: "%1$s" is not installed. Mounting of %2$s is not possible. Please ask your system administrator to install it.
translations.This application enables administrators:
This application enables administrators to configure connections to external storage providers, such as FTP servers, S3 or SWIFT object stores, other Nextcloud servers, WebDAV servers, and more. Administration can choose which types of storage to enable and can mount these storage locations for an account, a group, or the entire system. Users will see a new folder appear in their root Nextcloud directory, which they can access and use like any other Nextcloud folder. External storage also allows people to share files stored in these external locations. In these cases, the credentials for the owner of the file are used when the recipient requests the file from external storage, thereby ensuring that the recipient can access the shared file.

External storage can be configured using the GUI or at the command line. This second option provides the administration with more flexibility for configuring bulk external storage mounts and setting mount priorities. More information is available in the external storage GUI documentation and the external storage Configuration File documentation.
translations.To access the storage, you need to provi: To access the storage, you need to provide the authentication credentials.
translations.Unable to update this external storage c: Unable to update this external storage config. {statusMessage}
translations.There was an error with this external st: There was an error with this external storage.
translations.We were unable to check the external sto: We were unable to check the external storage {basename}
translations.Examine this faulty external storage con: Examine this faulty external storage configuration
translations.There was an error with this external st: There was an error with this external storage. Do you want to review this mount point config in the settings page?
There is no external storage configured. You can configure them in your Personal settings.
translations.There is no external storage configured: There is no external storage configured and you don't have the permission to configure them.
Type to select account or group.
translations.Automatic status checking is disabled du: Automatic status checking is disabled due to the large number of configured storages, click to check status
translations.Are you sure you want to disconnect this: Are you sure you want to disconnect this external storage? It will make the storage unavailable in Nextcloud and will lead to a deletion of these files and folders on any sync client that is currently connected but will not delete any files and folders on the external storage itself.
translations.No external storage configured or you do: No external storage configured or you don't have the permission to configure them
translations.External storage enables you to mount ex: External storage enables you to mount external storage services and devices as secondary Nextcloud storage devices. You may also allow people to mount their own external storage services.
translations.Allow people to mount external storage: Allow people to mount external storage
translations.Global credentials can be used to authen: Global credentials can be used to authenticate with multiple external storages that have the same credentials.
Type to select user or group.
translations.Storage with ID \"%d\" is not user edita: Storage with ID "%d" is not user editable
translations.Check the ACL's of each file or folder i: Check the ACL's of each file or folder inside a directory to filter out items where the user has no read permissions, comes with a performance penalty
translations.This application enables administrators:
This application enables administrators to configure connections to external storage providers, such as FTP servers, S3 or SWIFT object stores, other Nextcloud servers, WebDAV servers, and more. Administrators can choose which types of storage to enable and can mount these storage locations for a user, a group, or the entire system. Users will see a new folder appear in their root Nextcloud directory, which they can access and use like any other Nextcloud folder. External storage also allows users to share files stored in these external locations. In these cases, the credentials for the owner of the file are used when the recipient requests the file from external storage, thereby ensuring that the recipient can access the shared file.

External storage can be configured using the GUI or at the command line. This second option provides the advanced user with more flexibility for configuring bulk external storage mounts and setting mount priorities. More information is available in the external storage GUI documentation and the external storage Configuration File documentation.
translations.External storage enables you to mount ex: External storage enables you to mount external storage services and devices as secondary Nextcloud storage devices. You may also allow users to mount their own external storage services.
translations.Allow users to mount external storage: Allow users to mount external storage
translations.To access the storage, you need to provi: To access the storage, you need to provide the authentification informations.
